intro: Alpinia mesanthera, commonly known as the mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other well-known species like ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, leafy stalks and clusters of fragrant, pale yellow to orange flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Alpinia mesanthera thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
